result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus L Pantoja was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance due by 3/15/2022. Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with  case 14CF819; but consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with Miguel P. dob 2/8/67.
No contact with  1101 S. 1 Street, Milwaukee, WI or 1927 Wynona Lane, Milwaukee, WI.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No pssession of more than one cell phone or more than one phone number listed under the defendant's name at one time.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00.
May not live or work where a firearm or controlled substances are kept.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
______________
Under section 973.049, Court finds and prohibits contact with Miguel P. dob 2/8/67 as he was a coactor in the case and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Comply with all child support Court orders.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
_______________
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended  supervision and a violation of any of those conditions may result in  the defendant being returned to prison.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus L Pantoja

Defendant's pro se request for WSAP eligibility.
Certification of PLEA HEARING transcript commencing JULY 16, 2014, received and filed. (7 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  P. D.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (44 pages) commencing MARCH 4, 2015 received and filed. kl
Per clerical error: corrected to read "concurrent to 14CF819 (not 14CF519).
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, signed and filed.

Misc. documents from the Defense for the Court to review prior to Sentencing, received and filed.
In filed 14CF828.

Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Coralin A. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, concurrent to case 14CF819, but consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 374 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due by 3/15/2022; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No contact with Miguel P. (DOB 2-8-67).
-No contact with 1101 S. 1st Street, Milwaukee WI or 1927 Wynona Lane, Milwaukee, WI. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time. 
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00.
- Defendant may not live or work where a firearm or controlled substances are kept. 
- Maintain full time work. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Miguel P. (DOB 2-8-67) as he was a coactor in the case and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Marcus L Pantoja not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Defendant produced, but not brought into the Court for the case being rescheduled off the record. Defense requests adjournment for Sentencing. State does not object to an adjournment. Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 3-4-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in court with attorney Kristian Lindo for Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.
Jury Trial scheduled for 2-18-2015 is vacated.
Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 1-28-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case calendared for Plea Hearing on 1-26-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17 for possible global resolution with case 14CF819.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Marcus L Pantoja not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. Case did not go forward to Final Pretrial based on the oral ruling given in case 14CF819. Defense counsel states they wish to go forward to Jury Trial. 
Parties are notified that effective December 22, 2014 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 7, in Room 629 of the Courthouse. 
Per Br. 7, this case will remain calendared for Jury Trial on 2-18-15, Br. 7.

Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial. For the reasons placed on the record the case is adjourned for Final Pretrial on 12-22-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 2-18-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Calendar call scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 05:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
